result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric M. BILLMANN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Exposing Genitals, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Continue current counseling program or agent recommended alternative.

No contact with the victim.

Contact with minors at agent's discretion except defendant's biological children.

Provide a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric M. BILLMANN

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: All records scanned and verified.
Balance of $557.00 cash bail returned to Danielle Billmann by check instruction no: CR 61.

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Amended Information filed amending Count 1 to Exposing Genitals contrary to sec. 948.10(1)(b) of the Wisconsin Statutes.
Character letters filed on behalf of the defendant. (3)
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 31, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on May 18, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is reset to 04/12/2016 @ 11:00 a.m.

Stipulation and Order to Amend Conditions of Bond.
It is hereby ordered that the original conditions of bond are modified as follows:
The defendant is permitted to use a computer or other device solely for the purpose of viewing discovery materials to assist in his defense.
Copy to jail.

Stipulation and Order to Amend Conditions of Bond.
It is hereby ordered that the original conditions of bond are modified as follows:
1) the defendnat must report to the Kiel Police Department every Monday not later than 6:15 a.m. instead of every day.
Copy to jail, copy faxed to Kiel Police Department.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed. Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty pleas entered.  Jury calendar.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is set for 03-02-16 at 11:00 a.m.
Plea date is set for 05-18-16 at 3:00 p.m.
MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL -   
Attorney Cohen moves to amend the daily reporting condition from a daily report to a weekly report, every Monday by 6:15 a.m.  The State has no objection.  Attorney Cohen to draft the order.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
Minutes.

Stipulation and Order Amending Conditions of Bond.
It is hereby ordered that the original conditions of bail are modified as follows:
1) the no contact with any Kiel Area School District person is modified to permit the defendant's contact with his mother who is a substitute teacher in the school district;
2) the no contact with anyone under the age of 18 is modified to allow supervised contact with family members under 18.
All other conditions of bond remain as originally ordered.
Copy to jail.
Cover Letter.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.   Preliminary hearing is set for 01-06-16 at 9:00 a.m.   State moves to amend defendant's last name to "Billmann".  Motion granted.   
Minutes.
Request for Warrant for Communications or Other Information; Findings and Order; Warrant for Content of Communications or Other Records; Affidavit of Officer, Return of Officer.  (SEALED)

Search warrant issued.  RE: Samsung Notebook and Apple IPhone.
Affidait of Officer; Return of Officer.
Notice ot Party Furnishing Cash Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of expose child to harmful material and expose genitals.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 12-21-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 cash with the conditions that he report daily to the City of Kiel Police Department by 6:15 a.m., have no contact with M.C.M., DOB: 04-19-1999, anyone under the age fo 18, or any Kiel area school district buildings, premises or persons except for written contact through the principal to other coaches and no possession or use of any internet enabled devices.  Bail is furnished and the defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
